definition: to take to one's heels/to scram
to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to
to scatter/to sprinkle/to spill
leg/CL:條|条[tiao2]

sentences.english: He came out from the water immediately, climbed up the bank, and made off for home at once.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速浮出水面，上岸後撒腿就往家跑。

sentences.english: The wild animals, large and small, all fled for their lives.
sentences.chinese: 大大小小的野獸都嚇得撒腿就逃。

sentences.english: Tsunami warning after hearing the broadcast, he started for higher ground and ran.
sentences.chinese: 聽到海嘯預警的廣播後，他撒腿就往高地跑。

sentences.english: Or does the pile of laundry in the corner make you want run screaming in the other direction?
sentences.chinese: 還是角落的一堆髒衣服讓你有尖叫着撒腿跑開的衝動？

sentences.english: Breaking the valuable vase in the Museum, the children cut and ran.
sentences.chinese: 打碎了博物館裏的珍貴花瓶，孩子們撒腿就跑。

sentences.english: Sensing danger, they started to run.
sentences.chinese: 他們感到危險，撒腿就跑。

sentences.english: This terrible threat caused the two women to fall off immediately.
sentences.chinese: 兩個女人，一聽到這聲可怕的嚇唬，撒腿就跑。

sentences.english: I turned on my heel and started to run but my body didn't move.
sentences.chinese: 我想撒腿就跑但是身子卻動不了。

sentences.english: Do not to run past a dog.
In the company of strangers, in the quiet of the railway station, running scared.
sentences.chinese: 死寂的地鐵站到處是陌生的面孔，嚇得我撒腿就跑。

sentences.english: When church was over, the nixie saw that the birds had flown away, and she followed them with long strides.
sentences.chinese: 水妖從教堂回來，發現小鳥們飛走了，撒腿就追。

sentences.english: So I run. I run to the other corner of the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 我撒腿就跑到橋的另一個角。

definition: (dialect) to rush off/to scamper off double-quick/to take to one's heels/to make oneself scarce
to break into a run
like a wisp of smoke/(to disappear etc) in an instant
to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop
rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
to escape/to flee/to run away
to run off/to beat it
to vanish/to be nowhere to be found/unfounded (story)
to rush out through a door (idiom)
to dash (run fast)/to rush/to dart
to leave in stealth/to slip away
see 一哄而散[yi1 hong1 er2 san4]
to steal away/to beat it
to lose one's life/to die/recklessly/desperately
at a fast pace
glad and diligent
